I've been learning web development for just under a month, using Claude Code and building portfolio projects that solve real problems instead of toy apps. Currently focused on AI-powered tools that run locally—no cloud dependencies, no subscriptions.

My setup (i9-13900K, 48GB RAM, RTX 5070 Ti) is built specifically for local AI workloads. I'm exploring practical applications of transformer models, speech recognition, and interview analysis tools.

projects.title: Job Application Analyzer
projects.tagline: Browser extension that analyzes job postings against your CV
projects.description: Firefox extension that automatically detects job postings on LinkedIn, Indeed, and Reed, then analyzes match quality against your uploaded CV. Built because I needed it during my job search.
projects.long_description:
Automatically detects job postings while browsing LinkedIn, Indeed, and Reed. Analyzes requirements against your CV to provide match scores and specific recommendations. Shows which skills you have, which you're missing, and suggestions for how to position your experience.

Built to solve a real problem: spending hours manually comparing job requirements to my CV. Now it happens automatically as I browse.
features: Auto-detection of job postings on major platforms

metrics.users: Personal use, preparing for public release

projects.portfolio_notes: Demonstrates: React component architecture, TypeScript type safety, browser extension development, practical problem-solving, consistent release management, professional documentation
projects.why_built: I was job searching and manually comparing dozens of job postings to my CV. This automates the entire process and gives me better insights than I could generate manually.
challenges_solved: Cross-platform detection (different HTML structures on each job site)
Accurate CV parsing and skill extraction
Real-time analysis without blocking the UI
Clean UX that doesn't interfere with normal browsing
future_plans: Cover letter generation based on match analysis

projects.title: Community Support Platform
projects.tagline: Full-stack platform for peer-to-peer community assistance
projects.description: A community support platform for adults needing flexible peer-to-peer assistance. Full-stack application with React frontend, Node.js backend, and PostgreSQL database.
projects.long_description:
Platform designed for community-based support systems where adults can request and offer help. Features a points-based economy, trust system, and comprehensive task management.

Built to explore full-stack architecture and complex business logic. Includes realistic demo data and professional-grade system design.
projects.portfolio_notes: Demonstrates: Full-stack development, database design, API architecture, authentication/authorization, complex business logic, state management, professional documentation
projects.why_built: Wanted to build something more complex than a CRUD app. This explores multi-user systems, trust mechanisms, and real-world business logic challenges.
challenges_solved: Designing a fair points economy system
projects.deployment_notes: Encountered challenges with various platforms (Railway, Render, Vercel). Working through npm installation and CLI setup issues. Good learning experience in DevOps realities.

projects.title: AI Interview Analysis Tool
projects.description: AI tool that runs locally to analyze interview performance using Whisper for transcription and Llama models for feedback. No cloud dependencies.
projects.long_description:
Records interview sessions (practice or real), transcribes using OpenAI's Whisper model running locally, then uses Llama models to provide detailed performance feedback on communication, technical accuracy, and presentation.

Designed to run entirely on local hardware (RTX 5070 Ti) - no data leaves your machine, no subscription costs.
projects.portfolio_notes: Demonstrates: AI/ML interest, practical use of transformer models, local inference optimization, privacy-first design, leveraging powerful hardware for real applications
projects.why_built: Practicing for interviews and wanted objective feedback without recording myself for cloud services. This leverages my high-end GPU for something genuinely useful.
challenges_to_solve: Selecting appropriate Llama model size for feedback quality vs speed
Building intuitive UI for recording and review
future_plans: Test with real interview practice sessions
Refine feedback prompts based on results
